SubTopics: Solve real-world and mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.
Content: Mr. Thomsen is buying two types of gift cards to give as prizes to employees at a company meeting. He will buy restaurant gift cards that each cost $50. He will also buy movie theater gift cards that each cost $20. He has $450 to buy a total of 15 gift cards. How many of each type of gift card can Mr. Thomsen buy?

A.Choice: He can buy 5 restaurant gift cards and 10 movie theater gift cards.

B.Choice: He can buy 8 restaurant gift cards and 7 movie theater gift cards.

C.Choice: He can buy 10 restaurant gift cards and 5 movie theater gift cards.

D.Choice: He can buy 12 restaurant gift cards and 3 movie theater gift cards.

SubTopics: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x, y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.
Content: The relationship between temperature in degrees Fahrenheit and degrees Celsius is shown in the graph below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/2a.jpg
What is the meaning of the y-intercept?

A.Choice: the change in degrees Fahrenheit for every change of one degree Celsius

B.Choice: the change in degrees Celsius for every change of one degree Fahrenheit

C.Choice: the temperature in degrees Fahrenheit when the temperature is zero degrees Celsius

D.Choice: the temperature in degrees Celsius when the temperature is zero degrees Fahrenheit

SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in the form of a single digit times an integer power of 10 to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: Kevin moved from a city to a small town. The population of the city is 6 × 10⁵, which is about 15 times as great as the small town. Which expression could represent the approximate population of the small town?

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is congruent to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, and translations; given two congruent figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the congruence between them.
Content: Pentagon P and pentagon Q, shown below, are congruent.
problems/NY16G8M/media/4a.jpg
Which sequence could be used to transform pentagon P to pentagon Q?

A.Choice: a 180° clockwise rotation about the origin

B.Choice: a translation four units left and then a reflection over the x-axis

C.Choice: a reflection over the y-axis and then a translation seven units down

D.Choice: a translation seven units down and then a 90° clockwise rotation about the origin

SubTopics: Solve systems of two linear equations in two variables algebraically, and estimate solutions by graphing the equations. Solve simple cases by inspection.
Content: The graph of a system of equations is shown below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/5a.jpg
What system of equations represents the graph?

SubTopics: Know the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: A cylinder and a cone have congruent heights and radii. What is the ratio of the volume of the cone to the volume of the cylinder?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: Which of the equations listed below are linear equations?

:box:Equation I: C = 2πr

Equation II: A = πr²

Equation III: V = (4/3)πr³

SubTopics: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data to investigate patterns of association between two quantities. Describe patterns such as clustering, outliers, positive or negative association, linear association, and nonlinear association.
Content: The scatter plot below shows the points scored and the points allowed by the Bulldogs football team for several games.
problems/NY16G8M/media/8a.jpg
Which association (correlation) best describes the data?

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: The graph below shows the relationship between the distances run and the time for three people in a 100-yard race.
problems/NY16G8M/media/9a.jpg

The relationship between the distance run and the time for Kofi can be represented by the equation y = 15.55x, where he ran y yards in x seconds. Which two equations could be used to represent this relationship for Bella and Elsie?

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: Which table of values represents a linear function?

SubTopics: Know and apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
Content: Simplify.
:box:5⁻⁸ × 5⁴

SubTopics: Solve linear equations with rational number coefficients, including equations whose solutions require expanding expressions using the distributive property and collecting like terms.
Content: What is the value of t that satisfies the equation below?

SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in the form of a single digit times an integer power of 10 to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: Ellentown College has approximately 3 x 10³ students and Pengrove University has approximately 30,000 students. How many times as much is the number of students at Pengrove University as the number of students at Ellentown College?

SubTopics: Understand that a two-dimensional figure is similar to another if the second can be obtained from the first by a sequence of rotations, reflections, translations, and dilations; given two similar two-dimensional figures, describe a sequence that exhibits the similarity between them.
Content: A series of transformations on quadrilateral S resulted in quadrilateral T.

:box:• The angle measures of quadrilateral T are congruent to those of quadrilateral S.

• The side lengths of quadrilateral T are twice as long as those of quadrilateral S.
Which transformation on quadrilateral S must be included to result in quadrilateral T?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Function 1 is represented by the equation y = (–4/5)x – 2, and function 2 is represented by the graph below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/21a.jpg
For which of the functions are all the output values less than –1?

SubTopics: Lines are taken to lines, and line segments to line segments of the same length.
Content: Rectangle FGHJ, shown below, is translated 6 units right and 1 unit up to produce rectangle F'G'H'J'
problems/NY16G8M/media/22a.jpg
Which statement about the side lengths of rectangle F'G'H'J' is true?

SubTopics: Solve systems of two linear equations in two variables algebraically, and estimate solutions by graphing the equations. Solve simple cases by inspection.
Content: Solve the system of equations below.

SubTopics: Describe the effect of dilations, translations, rotations, and reflections on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Content: Mia enlarged a plan for an outdoor stage. The original plan is shown below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/28a.jpg
She dilated the outdoor stage by a scale factor of four with the center of dilation at the origin. Which ordered pair will be the coordinates of one of the new vertices?

SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in the form of a single digit times an integer power of 10 to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: Bianca and Nick are both musicians who sell their songs online. During the same year, Bianca sold 8 × 10⁵ downloads of her songs and Nick sold 4 × 10⁶ downloads of his songs. How many times as much is the number of songs that Nick sold than the number of songs that Bianca sold?

SubTopics: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.
Content: Which table represents a relation that is not a function?

SubTopics: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table. Construct and interpret a two-way table summarizing data on two categorical variables collected from the same subjects. Use relative frequencies calculated for rows or columns to describe possible association between the two variables.
Content: The Ecology Club was planning to take a field trip either to the seacoast or the mountains. The club president surveyed all of the members to determine the preferred trip. The results are displayed in the table below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/34a.jpg
Which statement is true about the results of the survey?

A.Choice: 20% of eighth-grade students preferred the seacoast

B.Choice: 32% of seventh-grade students preferred the mountains

SubTopics: Know the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres and use them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: A cylinder has a radius of 3 inches and a height of 4 3/4 inches. A sphere has a radius of 3 inches. What is the difference between the volumes, to the nearest tenth of a cubic inch, of the cylinder and the sphere?

SubTopics: Graph proportional relationships, interpreting the unit rate as the slope of the graph. Compare two different proportional relationships represented in different ways.
Content: Two friends work at different companies, P and S. Both companies use the number of hours that an employee works to calculate that employee's vacation hours. The relationship between the number of hours worked and the number of vacation hours for employees at each company is shown in the table and graph, respectively.
problems/NY16G8M/media/36a.jpg
problems/NY16G8M/media/36b.jpg
Which statement describes the difference in each friend's vacation hours if both work 2,080 hours?

A.Choice: The friend at company S will have about 42 more vacation hours than the friend at company P.

B.Choice: The friend at company S will have about 46 more vacation hours than the friend at company P.

C.Choice: The friend at company P will have about eight more vacation hours than the friend at company S.

D.Choice: The friend at company P will have about nine more vacation hours than the friend at company S.

SubTopics: Interpret the equation y = mx + b as defining a linear function, whose graph is a straight line; give examples of functions that are not linear.
Content: Which equation represents a nonlinear function?

SubTopics: Perform operations with numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used. Use scientific notation and choose units of appropriate size for measurements of very large or very small quantities (e.g., use millimeters per year for seafloor spreading). Interpret scientific notation that has been generated by technology.
Content: What is the value of the expression below?

SubTopics: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x, y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph. Interpret the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.
Content: A crane is lowering a concrete block from a height of 270 feet above the ground at a constant rate of 2.5 feet per second. Which function can be used to determine h, the height, in feet, above the ground of the concrete block after s seconds?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Function P is a linear function with a y-intercept of 5. Function Q is defined by the equation y = (–1/3)x + 4. Which statement must be true about functions P and Q?

A.Choice: Both functions have the same slope.

B.Choice: Both functions have a negative slope.

C.Choice: The functions will have the same input when y = 0.

D.Choice: The functions will have different outputs when x= 0.

SubTopics: Know that straight lines are widely used to model relationships between two quantitative variables. For scatter plots that suggest a linear association, informally fit a straight line, and informally assess the model fit by judging the closeness of the data points to the line.
Content: Line k is the line of best fit for a set of data on a scatter plot. The data show a strong linear association. Which scatter plot best represents these data and line k?

SubTopics: Use informal arguments to establish facts about the angle sum and exterior angle of triangles, about the angles created when parallel lines are cut by a transversal, and the angle-angle criterion for similarity of triangles.
Verify experimentally the properties of rotations, reflections, and translations.
Content: In the diagram below, lines MN and JK are parallel and are intersected by line QT.
problems/NY16G8M/media/47a.jpg
Which transformation could be used to show that ∠MRS is congruent to ∠JST?

C.Choice: translate ∠MRS down and to the right

D.Choice: dilate ∠MRS by a scale factor of two with the center at point R

SubTopics: Use similar triangles to explain why the slope m is the same between any two distinct points on a non-vertical line in the coordinate plane; derive the equation y = mx for a line through the origin and the equation y = mx + b for a line intercepting the vertical axis at b.
Content: What is the equation of the line that passes through points (–3, 0.5) and (3, –0.5)?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Function J is shown on the coordinate grid below.
problems/NY16G8M/media/49a.jpg
If the y-intercept of Function R is 3/2 greater than the y-intercept of Function J, which equation could represent Function R?
